item.description: Sweden's former top virus expert says lockdowns are just a way of delaying the inevitable and warns that New Zealand could face years of quarantining foreigners entering the country, even after wiping ...

item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: Waikato, New Zealand, Hamilton, Water, Health, Politics, Lifestyle, Property, National, Premium, Hamilton News
item.title: 'Insulting': Council offers $1 for lifestyle block land to doctors fighting Covid-19
item.description:
At work, two sets of doctors fight against Covid-19. At home, they're battling the council which is acquiring parts of their properties with no compensation.
On the outskirts of Hamilton, on a quiet ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/DrScottRobinson_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Dr Scott Robinson has been offered $1 compensation by Hamilton City Council for 5000 square metres of his land. Photo / Alan Gibson
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/050520SPLROBINSON1_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Dr Scott Robinson in full PPE at work. Photo / Supplied
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/050520SPLSOUTHGATE2_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Paula Southgate, Mayor of Hamilton. Photo / Supplied

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/EugenieSage_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Land Information Minister Eugenie Sage says in one case Hamilton City Council's compulsory land acquisition is so unusual she has asked for scrutiny of that part of the Act. Photo / Duncan Brown

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/Margotroaddesignation_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=An aerial view of the Buchanan property on Peacockes Rd, with the original plan to take 1279sqm off the bottom for the controversial road widening. Photo / Supplied

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/PaulaSouthgate_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Hamilton mayor Paula Southgate says the city council is following a fair process to acquire land for road widening at Peacockes. Photo / File

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/MargotB_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Margot Buchanan at the boundary of her property on Peacockes Rd. Hamilton City Council wants a portion of the land without compensation for ride widening. Photo / Alan Gibson

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/Margotonroad_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Dr Margot Buchanan on Peacockes Rd. She and husband Dr Cam Buchanan are also having part of their land compulsorily acquired by Hamilton City Council. Photo / Alan Gibson

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202018/DrsScottandCatRobinson_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Dr Scott Robinson, his partner Dr Cat Chang and their daughter Maia Robinson understand the need for affordable housing but believe they are not being treated fairly. Photo / Alan Gibson

New Zealand Rugby has engaged in talks with a multi-billion-dollar American investment firm about taking a stake in the struggling sport.
In what could prove a landmark moment in the game's ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/RWC2021_004_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=World Rugby chairman Bill Beaumont and New Zealand Rugby chief executive Mark Robinson. Photo / Photosport

item.nzh-sem:metakeywords: Timaru, New Zealand, Canterbury, Premium, Pregnancy and Childbirth, Parenting, Hospitals, Health, Privacy, South Island, National
item.title: Switched at birth: Two Kiwi girls were raised in the wrong lives, until they ended up with one set of parents
item.description:
Thirty years ago two girls were born in a South Island maternity ward.
One baby was born to a local businessman and his wife.
The other, to a beneficiary.
The babies were healthy and the parents ...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/41475814_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The hospital botch-up impacted on the lives of the girls, their parents and siblings. Photo / 123RF
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/96635592_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The case made headlines around the world. Photo / 123RF
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/101345945_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The woman who spoke to the Weekend Herald said she felt robbed. Photo / 123RF

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/47050307_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The hospital launched an investigation as soon as they found out the babies had been swapped. Photo / 123RF
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/93440067_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The swap happened at Timaru Hospital several hours after the babies were born. Photo / 123RF

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/109517759_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The mother of a baby swapped at birth 30 years ago has spoken out for the first time. She says her life was "ruined" because of the incident. Photo / 123RF
https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/92906783_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=There have been no other baby swaps in New Zealand since the Timaru case. Photo / 123RF

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/43198323_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=The baby girls were mistakenly swapped while in a communal area as their mothers showered. Photo / 123RF

https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202019/45835226_m_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=Thirty years ago two girls were swapped at birth. Today for the first time, one mother tells her full story. Photo / 123RF
